title: I would like my account reviewed - perma banned on a account that ive spent over $1000 on..
body:
Ok, So I just had a game and there was this twitch claiming that he was in plat division and didn't do well in lane so he decided to afk and talk rubbish the entire game, and of course I would retaliate and get upset. After that game, I got a "thank you for your report and helping the league of legends community" Ect. Straight after that, I got perma banned. I have been punished before however I was unaware that I would get such a punishment considering that I'm a high paying customer to league. Just three days ago or so I just spent $40 for skins.. and I've easily spent way over $1000 on my account. I am willing to accept punishment, 3 month ban or longer would be fine. 

However I've spent money on this account every week for the past 2 and a half years, This is totally not cool.
Please just review my account, You can see in my chat logs that I did not say a lot that was offensive, I didn't even swear really. 
thanks, Ed....

replies.body: You can report riot games to The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission that they blocked you from your product. Riot has to refund you all the money you have spent on the OCE server since you are a consumer who has paid for products digital or physical, you have the right to access/use it since you have paid for it.
I don't think it does, even though this would make a lot of sense. I agreed to their terms of agreement and broke the rules.

No harm in calling The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission and asking them about your situation. I am sure though even if you agreed to riot's teams of agreement, that they are not above Australia's Laws.

The ban system does not account for how much money you spend, only your behaviour. Except in extreme cases you will face a 10 game chat restriction, then a 25 game chat restriction, then a 14 day ban before receiving a perma. This should have been ample warning of the possibility of a perma ban. If this was not the case, then you should sumbit a support ticket and they will look into it for you.

Riot will not remove a ban unless it was made in error. If the punishment was dealt legitimately you will not get your account back. You are however free to make a new one if you so wish, with the same conditions in place.

If you believe the ban was made in error then submit a support ticket and the support team will look into it for you.

Negativity is all around OCE, its normal for one too react to others. I don't believe in this permanent ban solution would be a fix when one is simply standing up for themselves. Therefore I don't agree with the league of legends system and neither do my friends. As Wuks said, its highly unlikely that I will be getting my account back. So I'm not going to waste my time here, Thanks for your reply.

It is unfortunate, I can only really give you context on the decision. Basically it comes down to, whether it's in response to something or not, toxic is still toxic. In all likelihood the instigator was punished as well. It's not trying to stop you from standing up for yourself, but abusing someone in return doesn't really qualify. However I don't know exactly what you did so I'm not going to assume.

Unfortunately that's the way it is, and the way it will stay. If you don't wish to make another account then that is entirely your choice.

If you have chat logs available, feel free to post them here, and we can give them a look and tell you what we see/think; but as Seras mentions, behavioral suspensions are rarely reversed (especially permanent suspensions).

If you decide to post your chat logs, please do so in the Player Behaviour sub-boards, linked below:

http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behaviour

There is no chance that I would be making a new account.. permanent ban is such a harsh punishment. My chat logs only show myself typing therefore, It obviously doesn't look good. I just believe that such a harsh punishment shouldn't be enforced so quickly without giving a warning that it would.. I was not aware that my account would get too a permanent ban, ever.

I've decided to leave league of legends. Thanks for your reply anyway.
Australian Laws trumps riots player agreements/T&C.
